alert.note: Alert for Putnam; Westchester (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 11 at 8:39PM EDT until September 11 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR CENTRAL FAIRFIELD, EAST CENTRAL PUTNAM AND NORTHERN WESTCHESTER COUNTIES... At 839 PM EDT, Doppler radar estimated between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Rain has ended but flash flooding may still be ongoing. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Danbury, Ridgefield and Peach Lake. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
